messageBody:
caowei wrote:

> Hi group,
>
> I'm studying on the source codes of Junit.When i look into the
> TestResult class,
> there is a clone operation called cloneListeners in the
> addError,addFailure method,
> I'm puzzled at this, why the listeners need be cloned and fFailures and
> fErrors no need to be cloned.
> Can anyone give some hints on this?

Good question!

This operation simply makes a copy of the current list of test listeners
for iteration, to avoid concurrency problems while notifying the test
listeners of the various testing events (start, end, failure, error). It
is a common concurrent programming idiom: clone the collection before
iterating over it. Any book on concurrent programming will probably
describe it.
